org.gcn.plinguacore.simulator

Interface ISimulator

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractDnd2Sim, AbstractDndProbabilisticSimulator, AbstractProbabilisticSimulator, AbstractSelectionExecutionSimulator, AbstractSimulator, ActiveMembranesSimulator, AlternativeStepsSupportedSimulator, BinomialProbabilisticSimulator, CellLikeSimulator, CopyOfAbstractSimulator, DCBAProbabilisticSimulator, DecoratorSimulator, Dnd2SimParallel, Dnd2SimSeq, Dnd3ProbabilisticSimulator, Dnd4ProbabilisticSimulator, DndProbabilisticSimulatorParallel, DndProbabilisticSimulatorSequential, NoMaximalSim, NonDeterministicTransitionSimulator, NonDeterministicTransitionSimulator2, ProbabilisticSimulator, SpikingSimulator, StepBackSupportedSimulator, TissueLikeSimulator, TransitionSimulator, TSCSSimulator

    public interface ISimulator
extends java.io.Serializable
    This interface provides all common methods for all kind of simulator IMPORTANT: Classes which implement this interface or extend both DecoratorSimulator and Simulator should have only fields which implement java.io.Serializable. Those fields which are not serializable should be transient. Otherwise, the simulator instances won't be able to be saved to object fields.

      • step

        boolean step()
      throws PlinguaCoreException
        Takes one step of simulation and generate a new configuration
        Returns:
        false if the current configuration is a halting one. True if a new configuration was generated.
        Throws:
        PlinguaCoreException - if a semantic error occurs

      • alternateStep

        boolean alternateStep()
               throws java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Makes one alternate step of the last one.
        Returns:
        false if there is not alternate configurations. True if a new configuration was generated.
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if alternate steps are not supported

      • countAlternatives

        int countAlternatives()
               throws java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Counts the alternative steps which could be taken
        Returns:
        The number of possible next configurations in the next level of the non-deterministic tree
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if alternate steps are not supported

      • stepBack

        boolean stepBack()
          throws java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Takes one step back
        Returns:
        false if the current configuration is the initial one. True if a new configuration was generated.
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if steps back are not supported
